page.title: 19Transport in Billingshurst
page.content: Only 3{bus services}operate in one part of the district, 2 of which go North-South. The{railway}line is also North-South (London to the coast). Those public transport services which do exist tend to be hourly or less frequent & stop running around{10pm. This means a heavy reliance on private transport, particularly for East-West travel or evening entertainment. For young people{bicycles}can help, & many save for{motorbikes}but narrow country roads are badly maintained & ill-lit & thus unsafe at night. The{car}thus dominates, choking the village in Summer as people vacation in the West Country, & bouncing around narrow lanes dodging cows, sheep & potholes. Small cars such as VW Golfs & larger ones such as BMW's & Cavaliers are popular and there seems some market resistance to Japanese imports.
